review I orignally listened to this on CD, and I have to they picked the absolute perfect person (Lori Petty) to read the book! If this series ever becomes a I orignally listened to this on CD, and I have to they picked the absolute perfect person (Lori Petty) to read the book! If this series ever becomes a TV show (please please please), she is the one person I can totally see pulling off the role of Stephanie. Anyway, the main character is a gun toting (minus the bullets) Jersey Girl who starts bounty hunting for her cousin Vinnie (I kid you not) when she loses her job. The stories takes place in the Trenton (Chambersburgh) area, and I do think this originally was a draw for me having lived in NJ for a number of years but I was sucked in by the easy writing style and utter insanity... There are more laugh out loud moments in this series than on most comedies I see on TV. The first case Stephanie has is to hunt down Joe Morelli, a Trenton cop who skipped bail. Now, Stephanie has some history with Morelli... like playing train in his father's garage as a grade schooler and having 4 minutes of bliss behind the counter at Tasty Pastry while in high school all before trying to run him down with her car - so this is going to be tricky. In a series on mis-steps and accidents, Stephanie finally gets her man. ...more

review Again, nothing really new - LOVE these books... In this "episode" we meet a new character - Sally Sweet. He is a cross dressing drag queen... yep... th Again, nothing really new - LOVE these books... In this "episode" we meet a new character - Sally Sweet. He is a cross dressing drag queen... yep... that's what I said. And Joyce is back - Stephanie's arch rival... in bouty hunting (now) and with her husband, Dickie (then). Surprise, Joyce is the reason for the demise of Stephanie's short lived marriage to Dickie, a trenton attorney. Jealousy over Stephanie's relationship with Sally creates tension until things start to explode, literally, and Stephanie is "forced" to stay at Joe Morelli's house - oh boy. But that is where is hospitality ends - "No!" Morelli said. "You can't boorow my pickup. You are death on cars." I tend to find myself reading for the characters more than the individual mysteries (which is why I didn't really write about that in this review). These books crack me up and when Stephanie's eye starts to twitch, I can't help but laugh. Watch out for pistol-packing Grandma and Lulu... they are in rare form again! ...more

review Again, fast-paced book with a quirky heroine, Stephanie Plum - Jersey Girl Extrordinaire... Morelli is back too, and hello Ranger... Ranger is a co-wo Again, fast-paced book with a quirky heroine, Stephanie Plum - Jersey Girl Extrordinaire... Morelli is back too, and hello Ranger... Ranger is a co-worker... another bounty hunter that works for Vinnie who has offered to help showe Stephanie the ropes (yowza). Ranger is dark, mysterious, and sexy as hell. Stephanie, once again bumbles and fumbles her way through another mystery... this time with the help of Grandma Mazur whose number one past time is attending funerals in the Burgh. Summer movies typically have a body count toll - for Stephanie, it is a car count... She goes through more cars than you can imagine... and the Buick jokes... priceless. Laugh out loud funny... and an entertaining mystery to boot. ...more

review Cars exploding, strange people breaking into her apartment, and she's being followed by two goons in a minivan... just another day in the life of Step Cars exploding, strange people breaking into her apartment, and she's being followed by two goons in a minivan... just another day in the life of Stephanie Plum... Jersey Girl/Bounty Hunter... Great books - laugh out loud funny... very entertaining!!! In this book, her other love interest, Ranger, is accused of murdering a mob boss'ss son and Vinnie wants Steph to bring Ranger in. As if! Meanwhile she talks a skip off a bridge with the arguement that jumping was a bad way to go because it would ruin her hair for the viewing... Funerals are one of the favorite pastimes in the Burgh. Mooner and Dougie, the loveable stoners are introduced in this book and Bob the dog and Rex the hamster are back... Did I mention Grandma Mazur moves in with Stephanie... lol ...more

review Ok - so I can't really say anything new here... These books are priceless. My mom wants to be friends with Janet Evanovich and I want to be friends wi Ok - so I can't really say anything new here... These books are priceless. My mom wants to be friends with Janet Evanovich and I want to be friends with her characters - LOL. Stephanie is tasked with finding Uncle Mo, a local candy shop owner. Uncle Mo is the equivalent of Santa in the Burgh which needless to say, makes Stephanie a tad bit unpopular. She decides to get in shape and takes to 6AM runs with Ranger - How long will that last when her primary food groups are Donuts, Beer, Pizza and Twinkies? Lulu fills in the Grandma Mazur void and the car troubles continue... The bodies start to pile up and it makes you wonder what is really going on. Well, trust me, you will never guess... This about sums up Stephanie - "How could a person's instints be so wrong and at the same time so right?" ...more

review Stephanie Plum - a dysfuncional NJ bounty hunter - meets Jeanne Ellen Burrows... the bounty hunter she aspires to be... cool, mysterious and always ge Stephanie Plum - a dysfuncional NJ bounty hunter - meets Jeanne Ellen Burrows... the bounty hunter she aspires to be... cool, mysterious and always gets her man - usually without landing on a table of fast food, being chased by dogs or ending up on the wrong end of a stun gun. And this lady has a mysterious past with Ranger. I have officially run out of steam writing these reviews, but Evanovich makes me laugh out loud... she can do no wrong for me... keep em coming! ...more

review This is actually one of my favorite books in the series... Stephanie decides she has had enough. No more being stalked, having her apartmen broken int This is actually one of my favorite books in the series... Stephanie decides she has had enough. No more being stalked, having her apartmen broken into and cars being blown up - no more... She decides to get a real job... After stints at the button factory, dry cleaner and Cluck in a Bucket, Stephanie ends up working at RangeMan. More about Ranger... : ) Of course this is a bit different than her previous experience working with Ranger - she has a cushy office job and her on-again-off-again boyfriend Morelli is less than pleased. Considering her change of profession, trouble still seems to find her. Lulu steps in with her Via Spigas to fill Stephanie's shoes in the bounty hunting department and Grandma Mazur is still visiting the funeral home on a regular basis trolling for a new boy toy... Come on - you have to laugh! ...more

review Janet Evanovich is at it again... laughed out loud and couldn't put this book down. Stephanie is looking for her missing uncle... and picks up a tail i Janet Evanovich is at it again... laughed out loud and couldn't put this book down. Stephanie is looking for her missing uncle... and picks up a tail in the process (of course). Bunchy, the Bookie, is looking for Fred too and decides to follow Stephanie to find him. It turns out that Fred stumbled on to some nepharious dealings with the local utilities. Apparantly dumb luck runs in the family. Meanwhile, Steph ends up with an unexpected house guest when a skip ends up staying with her until his apartment is repaired after his take down. She also finds that she needs extra money and takes a job with Ranger's company not really even knowing what it is that Ranger does. He gives her a car because Bertha (my name for her big blue buick) is going to ruin his image. Doesn't he know better and what exactly does she have to do to earn the car? Oh yeah and did I mention the last page cliff hanger... Ranger or Morelli? who did she pick out of the hat? Where is book number 6?!?!?!?! ...more

review Stephanie Plum - bounty hunter, Jersey Girl... Walking disaster... Morelli, Ranger, and "His Merry Men" are all once again trying to keep Stephanie sa Stephanie Plum - bounty hunter, Jersey Girl... Walking disaster... Morelli, Ranger, and "His Merry Men" are all once again trying to keep Stephanie safe. After hunting down a Visa skip, Stephanie becomes the target of a psychopathic (or is it psychotic?)cyber geek. The game is on and Stephanie is the prize. He is hunting her down and takes two of the people closest to her as hostages. She has to outwit him in order to save them all. Let me just tell you - the hostage thing had me peeing myself... and thus the dawn of a new relationship... lol Meanwhile - Stephanie's sister and her boyfriend have a baby and move into her apartment. Grandma Mazur is watching porn and has taken to imagining Ranger naked (who wouldn't?). Joe's Grandma Bella has visions... specifically visions of Stephanie in a casket - dead. AND Stephanie decides to catch Morelli in the act of "hiding the salami" with a mob princess... count the ways this can go wrong! Some random lines: Ranger: "I don't know what I swear. I can't think of anything awful enough to do to you that wouldn't leave you maimed of psychologically scarred." Stephanie: "Nice to know there are boundaries." Lulu: "I feel like Michael J. Fox in that werewolf movie. Remember when he started growing hair all over? It was like he was turning into Connie." "Being a mob boss in Trenton didn't get you on "America's Most Wanted." Trenton was just a midsize pothole in the organized crime highway." ...more

review What can I say, I am completely addicted... Very funny - Absolutely entertaining... Not long after Stephanie starts looking for Eddie DeChooch do the What can I say, I am completely addicted... Very funny - Absolutely entertaining... Not long after Stephanie starts looking for Eddie DeChooch do the bodies start showing up. Mooner and Dougie are back and Stephanie's sister shows up for dinner with her two kids fresh off a flight from CA. Saint Valerie's life has imploded and she is going to be sticking around for a while. Ranger offers his help, but that offer comes with strings attached... a night with Stephanie. Did I mention - Morelli proposes... mud wrestling, a Harley, and Bob, good ol Bob... lol ...more

review I began reading the Stephanie Plum books last year while I was moving into my new home. When I got done with all of the numbers available, I ran acros I began reading the Stephanie Plum books last year while I was moving into my new home. When I got done with all of the numbers available, I ran across this book... I would have preferred to read it in its proper order, but I wasn't aware of the "Between-the-Numbers" books at the time so in the absence of a full length book, what's a girl to do but read a "Between-the-Numbers" story. These books, at under 200 pages, are really just an appetizer for a numbers edition. This one introduces Diesel - yet another man in Stephanie's life to confuse her hormones and senses. He pops into her kitchen - literally - and teams up with her to track down "Sandy Claws." The book has a supernatural twist to it and kind of plays like one of those "Who shot JR?" twists - Is it all just a dream? However, it is light and Christmas-y so get out your Sugar Cookies and dig in. You have the familiar... Trenton, NJ - Stephanie hunging down a FTA, her crazy family, lucky good guys and bumbling bad guys. If given a choice to re-read one of the numbers or read this book again - Numbers would win, but I am glad I read this one - basically because it was there... ...more

review I read this after I read the second Barnaby novel (Motor Mouth) and in the middle of my Stephanie Plum obsession last summer. The story really moves, I read this after I read the second Barnaby novel (Motor Mouth) and in the middle of my Stephanie Plum obsession last summer. The story really moves, and I do appreciate Barnaby as a stronger female character then Stephanie Plum. The story has the same characteristics as a Numbers book, but not as many laugh out loud moments. Barnaby gets a bizarre call from her brother "Wild Bill" and picks up and goes to Miami to find his apartment ransacked and Bill missing apparantly along with Hooker's (NASCAR Guy) boat. Hooker sticks with her thinking that is the best chance at finding his boat and the two of them stumble into a mystery involving gold bars and bumbling bad guys. The play between Hooker and Barnaby is fun, but I could live another day without hearing Hooker refer to himself as "NASCAR Guy." The sidekicks are not up to Lulu and Grandma Mazur level, but Judey did crack me up. I can say that I did like this book a little more than I liked Motor Mouth, but overall these books read to me like second rate Stephanie Plum novels. ...more

review Well, my mom picked up this book in the middle of my Stephanie Plum obsession last year, and I read it basically because I was out of the numbers book Well, my mom picked up this book in the middle of my Stephanie Plum obsession last year, and I read it basically because I was out of the numbers books to read. I really don't like (kind of despise) the whole NASCAR thing, so Miami and NASCAR weren't too much of a draw for me. Unfortunately, two things are probably skewing this rating: 1) I read this book before Metro Girl so I missed some of the set up and 2) I read it while in the middle of a Stephanie Plum marathon... That being said the book was OK. NASCAR, while relevant to the plot, didn't really bug me too much, but I just didn't find this book laugh out loud funny like the Plum novels. I chuckled in a few parts, but there was nothing that I highlighted for my mom. (We pass books back and forth so the first one to read highlights parts we thing are hysterical or noteworthy so we don't ruin it for the other person by telling them before they read.) The plot has Barnaby and Hooker stealing a competitors NASCAR rig with one of their friends and a dead guy on board. The whole plot comes down to a high tech way of cheating during a race. I like Barney, she's smart and sassy... Hooker is unremarkable in the fact that he is typical of JE's male counterparts for Plum... slightly dangerous and probably not good for you, but you have to love him anyway. The cast of sidekicks weren't as fun as Lulu and Grandma Mazur, and the ending quite frankly bugged me. I was disappointed that the cheating thing seemed to be OK. Anyway, if you run out of Plum books, this one is ok... but in a competition - Stephanie wins hands down! ...more

review For a "Between-the-Numbers" book this one was pretty good... Stephanie Plum, Trenton, NJ's most famous or infamous bounty hunter is at it again. Howev For a "Between-the-Numbers" book this one was pretty good... Stephanie Plum, Trenton, NJ's most famous or infamous bounty hunter is at it again. However, at less than 200 pages these are hardly an appetizer for the Numbers books... I basically read it because it was there... Diesel is back from the other "Between-the-Numbers" books and he is looking for a leprechaun - Snuggy. These books usually have a supernatural twist and in this one, most of the regulars put in an appearance as well. So there goes my dream sequence idea for these books. Anyway, Grandma Mazur finds a bag of money and ends up in AC (Atlantic City for those not from Jersey) and the gang packs up and heads down there to rescue her (usually from herself). Somewhere along the line, Lulu gets a job modeling plus-sized underwear and Snuggy decides his leprechaun invisibility powers only work when he gets naked so there are plenty of things to laugh at/about. (The leprechaun think nearly made me pee myself. - Damn Dog... you'll understand that when you read it... lol) One of my favorite lines from Lulu: "We gonna go out and catch bad guys today? I'm wearing a thong two sizes too small, and I'm feeling mean as hell." It delivers on the laughs even though you know that this is a blatant attempt at cashing in on a hot series... ...more

review As with any book, know what you are getting into and set your expectations accordingly... These are not world in peril stories unless your world is Tr As with any book, know what you are getting into and set your expectations accordingly... These are not world in peril stories unless your world is Trenton, NJ and you are Stephanie Plum. These books are funny - laugh out loud hilarious at times. If you are looking for high drama - look elsewhere... "Just go away," Pickle said. "I have big problems. I'm a pervert." This isn't the best line of the book, but a random sampling... just open the book to any page and you can find treats like this. In this book, we find Stephanie being stalked by Ranger's wife... or is she... Well, she is being stalked by someone and the woman isn't happy. Ranger has been accused of kidnapping his daughter and Stephanie has to pose as bait to clear his name and rescue the girl. This is a good Ranger book for those that follow the Stephanie, Ranger, Morelli love triangle. We learn more about him in this one... woo hoo. In the meantime, Stephanie and Lulu occupy themselves by interviewing people for the office and "pretending to be bounty hunters." They pick up a woman who stabbed her husband in the ass - the nerve of him telling her she was getting fat in the middle of a menopausal hot flash... lol Lulu and Sally (the drag queen musician) have formed a new band and at some point Grandma Mazur gets in on the act - lol. Grandma Mazur in platform shoes... hah! ...more

review For those that haven't gotten my 50 positive reviews for these books at the same time: Laugh out loud funny, a real treat. LOVE these books... Got int For those that haven't gotten my 50 positive reviews for these books at the same time: Laugh out loud funny, a real treat. LOVE these books... Got into them last year as I was moving into my house. Between painting EVERY wall in the place and staying up late reading these books, I was sore all over and tired, but I had a great time doing it. This book finds Stephanie losing yet another car to a fire bombing incident... She is then the target for a local gang and must find a place to hide until she sorts it all out... what better place to do that then teh "Bat Cave" AKA - Ranger's apartment. Stephanie tracks it down and breaks in while Ranger is out of town and we get to hang out in his space while he is away... the scene where he comes back though - woo! Did I mention, Lulu and Stephanie think it would be a good idea to capture a guy, hold him prisoner, and torture him for information... lol, you can just guess how many ways that can go wrong... Random lines: "I was doing so many eye rolls these days I was getting head pains." "I didn't want to die. I had more donuts to eat." ...more

review As far as serial killer/murder mysteries go, this one kept my attention. The author has an easy writing style... the book reads fast and the story was As far as serial killer/murder mysteries go, this one kept my attention. The author has an easy writing style... the book reads fast and the story was intersting without being too predictable. I enjoy reading authors that have a central character(s)carried through the stories. Starting with this one makes me want to go back and start from the beginning with this author. ...more

review This is actually the third Tess Gerritsen book that I have read. As for the three things I pay attention to: characters, style and story, this one is This is actually the third Tess Gerritsen book that I have read. As for the three things I pay attention to: characters, style and story, this one is really good. Like her other books, it is easy to read and she brings back several characters you already know/love. Her Homicide Detective Jane Rizzoli has not been my favorite, but there are several scenes in this book that make me just love her. Imagine - a less than maternal pregnant woman, trapped in a hospital a week after she is due and being held hostage... If another author (Janet Evanovich for example) would have done this, I would have peed my pants laughing, but this is just another day in the life of Jane Rizzoli and she takes it in stride. In regards to the story, this is the best I have read so far from this author and one of the best thrillers I have read in a while. It was about a girl that came to America and got trapped in the world of human slavery/prostitution. By chance, her and a friend witness a horrible crime and in another stroke of luck escape and are forced to run. It totally sucked me in from the beginning and I HAD to finish the final 75 pages before I went to bed last night. A great mystery with an interesting story. ...more

review The second I have read by this author and overall, I wasn't really in love with the book. As always, easy to read, but her reoccurring main characters The second I have read by this author and overall, I wasn't really in love with the book. As always, easy to read, but her reoccurring main characters both kind of got on my nerves with the issues they were going through and their self deprecating attitudes were a bit much. (the one's ex husband returns and the will she/won't she fall for him again and the other's finding out she is pregnant by an FBI agent she worked a case with and hardly knows - REALLY? Come on...) The story was a little too conveinent and seems all to familiar. I could have read, seen a TV show or a Movie with this plot... nothing new was really added and the sub mystery seemed kind of just thrown in there and actually kind of wrapped up abrubtly. Overall, I am glad I read it for the character evolution, but if you aren't into reading the whole series by an author and need/want the story on the characters - you could really skip this one. ...more
